item.description: An exciting dice game for 2-4 young players.

The judge draws a Party Pictures Card from the deck and shows everyone. Players select the best matching Caption Card from their hands and place it face down. The judge reads the Caption Cards aloud and selects the funniest caption. The player with the funniest match wins the card! The first player to earn five Party Pictures wins.

Contents:
75 Picture Cards (150 photos)
300 Caption Cards
Instructions

name.value: Thomas die kleine Lokomotive und seine Freunde: Würfelpuzzle

item.description: This game is a combination of puzzling and rolling a dice. The player who manages to finish his puzzle at first wins.

name.value: World Wide Wob: Das Spiel um die Zukunft einer Stadt

item.description:
The players may play different roles to further develop Wolfsburg, a German town. 
They are experts in different domains, such as city development, real estate speculation, city council, VW group. The winner is the player who developed Wolfsburg the best.

Modern War #45, November 2019.

The Dragon and The Hermit Kingdom is a two player game that covers the hypothetical simulation of a second Korean War that could occur in the very near future. This game is a precursor to The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun (Modern War #42). It simulates the war that would have occurred on the Korean peninsula just prior to that game’s setting. The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun assumes that a Chinese victory had already occurred in Korea. This game, however, simulates the entirety of that preceding conflict, beginning with a supposed North Korean invasion of South Korea.

is a two player game that covers the hypothetical simulation of a second Korean War that could occur in the very near future. This game is a precursor to The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun (Modern War #42). It simulates the war that would have occurred on the Korean peninsula just prior to that game’s setting. The Dragon that Engulfed the Sun assumes that a Chinese victory had already occurred in Korea. This game, however, simulates the entirety of that preceding conflict, beginning with a supposed North Korean invasion of South Korea.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters.

Modern War #46 January 2020.

Foreign Legion Paratrooper is a solitaire wargame. The player controls the French forces. The game system controls various Opposition Forces (OPFOR). The game is played in missions (or scenarios). You can link the various missions into a larger campaign game. It is recommended that you first play a couple of games before playing a campaign game. While the game is designed as a solitaire game and requires only one player to play. The game can also be played by two or more players, each controlling different parts of the REP. Each turn equals anywhere from 12 hours to one week. Hexes on the Mission Map are anywhere from 0.5 to 5 kilometers across. A platoon is 30-60 soldiers. OPFOR units represent anywhere from 10 to 1000 fighters.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters

Modern War #47 March 2020

Objective Nuremberg is the first volume of what will grow to be a series of games, the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each subsequent single-volume game will use the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series, with the eventual goal being a mega-monster game covering the geographic entirety of this war across the whole East German and Czechoslovakian border areas. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare are represented abstractly, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day is made up of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 176 counters

Block by Block is a two-player conflict simulation of the 1968 Battle of Huáº¿. Players must balance the military difficulties imposed by the challenges of constrained urban warfare and unique terrain of the Huáº¿ Citadel, with the overriding considerations of each side’s respective political goals. The North Vietnamese player must hold the city for as long as possible, to create a media event and lay the groundwork for a new revolutionary government. The South Vietnamese and American player must retake Huáº¿ before this process can advance too far, but not also jeopardize their own political sensitivities from casualties and heavy-handedness. The map covers an area of 13 square kilometers (approximately 5 square miles). Each turn represents four to five days. Units represent platoon/detachment to battalion sized units.

—description from the publisher

Card game where players are trying to complete a Royal Flush (A, K, Q, J, 10 all in same suit.

Players are dealt seven cards. On each turn players first draw from the to of the draw pile or discard pile. Then player discards one card to the discard pile. If card is an action card then you follow instructions of the card. As soon as player acquires a Royal Flush (regardless if it is their turn) they take a chip for the suit in which they have a Royal Flush. Play continues until all chips have been claimed. Winner is the one with the most chips.

—user summary

With a light-hearted campy theme and action-packed gameplay, Apocalyptic Picnic takes the family reunion to a whole new level. The "potato salad" is tainted and everyone is turning into zombies. Be the last player to survive this picnic gone wrong and win the game! This is a card management game in which the key is in the cards and how and when they are used. By carefully managing their cards, a player must aim to wipe out all opponents and become the sole survivor!

Each player starts with a family consisting of five members (four healthy members and one zombie) and a hand of cards. On each turn, a player draws and plays cards. Offensive moves include using *BITE* cards to bite your opponents' family members and turn them into zombies. Players are limited in the number of bites they may play based on the number of zombies they have — which means you need to keep a few of these ghoulish guys around.

Go on the defensive by playing *FOOD* or *EQUIPMENT* cards that protect players from bites. Watch out for the *PLAY NOW* cards as they impact all players and their cards in someway.

The always healing "GrandMa's Homemade Chicken Noodle Soup" instantly turns one of that player's zombies back into a healthy family member. (Thanks Grandma!) The most lethal and powerful card of all — "Suspicious Seconds", a second heaping helping of that tainted potato salad — instantly turns a player into a zombie with an unblockable biting capacity. The last player with healthy members wins.

—description from the publisher

Pizza Ninja is the fastest and most honorable way to order pizzas. We guarantee 30 minutes delivery time or our delivery ninja will commit seppuku to regain honor. Order now (Not serving pirates)!

Pizza Ninja is a solitaire game, were you will deliver pizzas to hungry workers in a business building. But beware the pirates that want those pizzas too.

During each of your turns, you can take four actions to move the Ninja around the board and deliver one of your pizzas on random spots on the board. Or you can fight nearby pirates with your Ninja skills. But after you have done your actions, all the pirates will move closer to you and the pizzas and even more pirates will enter the office. If they reach you and hit you, you will loose some of your precious time.

You win, if you can deliver all your pizzas to spots on the board before the time runs out.

9 Lives is a card game where you'll be playing as a cat and the goal is to be the last cat standing. The game features quirky scenarios and funny artworks of cats doing crazy cat stuff. Its a game ideally played by friends and family during gatherings.

The game can be played by 2 to 5 players and can go from 15-30 minutes. You will be playing as a cat with 9 Lives and the goal is to eliminate other players before you own nine lives runs out. There are two decks in the game: the Paw cards, which allows you to play tricks and actions to give you the advantage; and Karma cards, which simulates the scenarios that happen on a player's turn. The game features an exciting balance of strategy and randomness which leaves keeping guessing how to play smarter on your next game.

—description from the designer

The Goblin King is Angry is a Competitive Cutthroat Co-Op Game for 3-6 Players in which the players, taking the roles of their unique goblin generals, send Hordes of Goblins at the Human Castle at the center of the board to be the last player to topple it and gain the king's favor.

Taking the Tower Defense genre and turning it on its head, this game is great for those wanting to bring vengeance upon the evil humans that destroy our kind for no reason.

—user summary

link.value: IION Games (It's In Our Nature Games)

item.description:
A simple dice game that requires 6 dice and a way to keep score. The goal is to score as few points as possible, while also attempting to knock the player to your left out of the game.

The player takes the 6 dice and rolls them with the objective of getting a total of 30 or more showing on the dice. After each roll the player must set aside one or more dice. The player's turn continues until all 6 dice have been set aside, and then the face value is added up to determine the total for that player.

If a total value of 30 is achieved, the player scores 0 points. If the total is LESS than 30, the player scores the difference in points (a roll of 26 would score the player 4 points). If the total is MORE than 30, the player takes all 6 dice and rolls again. Every die that shows their total - 30 is set aside and they continue rolling until they do not roll any more of that number or all 6 dice have been set aside. The player to the left then gains points equal to the total shown on the set aside dice.

Example: Player A's original roll totals 32. Player A rolls all 6 dice and gets one 2. That die is set aside and the remaining 5 dice are rolled. This time there are two more 2s. Those two dice are set aside and the remaining 3 dice are rolled. No more 2s are rolled so Player A stops. The player to Player A's left gains 6 points for the three 2s that were rolled.

The dice are then passed to the left and play continues.

Once a player scores 30 or more points, that player is eliminated from the game. The game ends when only one player remains and that player is the winner.

For a shorter game without player elimination, the game can be played until the first player scores above 30. When that happens, the player with the fewest points is the winner.

—user summary

DICTADORES is a card game for parties in which you must avoid being punished while getting drunk.
The dictator sets the laws of the game, if someone does not comply, he will be punished.
There are cards that force you to drink and others in which you must play to avoid it.
Each player will have his turn as a dictator, with all the privileges that means.
But beware of coups d'etat.
Do you dare to play it?

The game is played in three decks, the dictator will play with the punishment deck and the law deck, while the rest with the town deck.

A player starts assuming the role of DICTATOR and takes two punishments that he keeps in secret and a law that he puts on his back.

When the first player takes a card from the village deck he must comply with the instructions and this letter, and if it is his turn to drink, he must also comply with the laws.

If the player does not comply with a law, the dictator gives him a punishment.

When the dictator runs out of punishments, it is the turn of another.

In the town deck there are 4 coups. The first three allow the player to end the dictator's turn by removing his punishments. The fourth coup d'etat wins the game, and you can choose any punishment from the deck to give to the current dictator.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game Vol. 2: Saikyou Kuso Shinka!

item.description:
This is a game for 2 to 5 people that is a harsh parody of trading card games. The cards are intentionally overpowered and poorly balanced. It's based off of the comic Pop Team Epic.

—user summary

AmiAmi's sweepingly successful "Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game" is back with version 2!
This authentic trading card game-ish card game is upgraded to be even more Crapperific!
The highly rated Crap elements from the first version are strengthened in addition two new ones added like "hieroglyphic text" and "effects on other separate games" to reach a new level of Crappy.
This can be mixed with the 1st version and played to be even more special.
That's not all! It has lots of content from the "Pop Team Epic" anime starting with "Aoi Shouta" from the last episode to the "Takeshobo Building" which fans loved.
Some card game's illustrator drew 4 new fake illustrations that are collected here. Enjoy the beautiful illustrations of Popuko and Pipimi that are Magical Girl-ified and Monster-ified!

[We Refuse]

 This is a trading card game-ish variety card game. 90% of the content is crap, thank you for your kind understanding.
 No matter how crappy this card game is it can at the very least be used for regular card games.
 No matter what may happen during a battle the designer and seller take no responsibility. Please understand it is your own or another player's fault.




—description from the publisher

link.value: Pop Team Epic Kuso Card Game

item.description:
In Magalhães Bastos, the players will have to save the women who will appear in the neighborhood, solving their problems to win their hearts. Sagacity is necessary to move around the district, since the other players are a constant threat.

On his turn, a player performs three different actions from a menu of twelve. Most actions involve gaining, buying, selling or discarding various items and cards, often on specific board spaces. They also include moving the player's character, threatening (and possibly attacking) an opponent, earning money, hiring a security guard and winning a woman's heart - or stealing it from another player. The game ends after ten rounds or when any player's score goes past 32 points.

—user summary

Llamas Unleashed is an Unstable Unicorns game. The goal is to get 7 animals into your field before your opponents. A task that sounds much simpler than it is. 
 Llamas Unleashed is a fully playable base game that is NOT intended to be shuffled into your Unstable Unicorns games. It comes with 135 cards in a magnetic box, and it has the same base mechanics, but with a few twists.

In the game, you'll find 4 types of characters: Llamas, Alpacas, Goats, and Rams.

There are also magic cards, instant cards and upgrade/downgrade cards.

Playing certain cards only affect certain types, such as if you play a "Goatmeal Raisin Cookie" or a "Download More RAM."

In addition, there is a new mechanic called "Herd Bonus." If you get 3 of the same type of character in your Stable (now called a Field) at the same time, you get a Field Advantage! Think of it like an Upgrade card, except with no Upgrade in your Stable. Bonus effects range from extra card draw to protection to stealing from your friends. Be sure to strategize early though- if you don’t remember the Herd Bonus when choosing your Baby Animal, you might end up having a baaaad time!

Plus, each of the instant cards in the deck (equivalent to the Neighs you know) have an added bonus of allowing you to snatch up the card if it belongs to a specific type (ex. if you use the right "Neigh" on a Goat-type card, you can add it to your hand instead of sending it to the discard pile!)

The core mechanics are based on those of Unstable Unicorns, but there are a ton of new card effects that you've never seen before. Also, Llamas. How can you resist?

—description from the publisher

"Alley Oops! - A Raucous Game of Stumbling and Tumbling for Klutzes!”

Play the raucous game of stumbling and tumbling, Alley Oops! In this traditional American game you roll your colored magic tumbling bean on the ramped game board into a scoring hole. It’s fun and harder than it looks. Classic and addictive fun for the whole family in the original 1930’s retro box. A unique gift for any classic game collector.

Alley Oops was a popular American comic strip in the 1930’s. The name Alley Oops comes from French Gymnasts, who yell “Allez Hop!” (Let’s Go!) before tumbling on the gym mat.

—description from the publisher

This is a replica of a vintage board game from the 1930s.

Knightzz is a thrilling game derived from Chess Knight.

The game portraits knights quest for ancient relics. Knight's Movement in the board is same as that in chess game (L shaped moves) and no movement is allowed to previously occupied cells. One knight can conquer another knight in his path. The knight who collects 5 relics first will win the game.
A flicking table soccer game.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
From the rear of the box:

Whooopah! It’s time to join the legendary friends, from one of TV’s best-loved sitcoms in Friends Monopoly.
Play as either Ross, Rachel, Phoebe, Monica, Joey or Chandler by choosing one of the exclusive tokens which are iconic to the gang; will it be Rachel’s handbag, Ross’ dinosaur, Chandler’s sweater vest or even Phoebe’s acoustic guitar?
As you pi-VOT round the board you will discover the best Friends’ moments, from unmistakable Holiday Armadillo, to the hilarious Giant Poking Device and Monica and Chandler’s eventful, yet unforgettable wedding!
Enter the world of Friends Monopoly! You’re gonna love it!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Monica Gets a Roommate / Rachel Finds Out
LIGHT BLUE
Ross Finds Out / Giant Poking Device / No One's Ready
PINK
At The Beach / With The Cat / All The Wedding Dresses
ORANGE 
All The Thanksgivings / With The Cop / Ross' Teeth
RED 
The Routine / All The Candy / Holiday Armadillo
YELLOW 
Monica & Chandler's Wedding / The Halloween Party / Rachel Has A Baby, Part 2
GREEN 
The Lottery / In Barbados / Phoebe Gets Married
DARK BLUE 
The Last One, Part 1 / The Last One, Part 2
STATIONS
Relaxi Taxi / Phoebe's Grandma's Taxi / Monica's Sportscar / Joey's Boat
UTILITIES
Treeger's Electricity Maintenance / Treeger's Water Maintenance
TAXES
Central Perk Tab / Lose At American Football
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
APARTMENT 19 / APARTMENT 20

With shaking hands and a fast-beating heart, you prepare to add another block to the teetering tower. Will it continue to stand, or topple to the ground? A bead of sweat trickles down your forehead as you release the block, and then, the moment of truth. The tower sways for a second, then rights itself. It’s going to stay standing, at least for now. Although most of you are working as a team, one player is a Traitor trying to make the tower fall.

In Crazy Tower, players work together to get rid of their blocks and build a safe, stable structure. All of them, except for one that is. One player takes on the role of the Traitor, looking to deviously make a building that will collapse on another player’s turn. Will they succeed, or will the Tower stand the test of time? Either way, you can bet it’s going to be crazy!

On a turn, players can either place a block on the highest floor of the tower or place a new Floor and then add a block to that floor. A block may only ever be added to the highest Floor and must be laid following the instructions on the Floor. If the team successfully places their final piece on the Tower, they win the game, but if it falls and it’s not on the Saboteur’s turn, then they win.

True Crime Legends is a gangster themed, deck building card game for 3-5 players. It takes around an hour to play. Players will lead a syndicate competing to control the lucrative and dangerous markets of the underworld. Invest in assets, smuggle, bribe, murder, steal and hire legendary gangsters from a deck of the most iconic criminals of the past century, each with unique stats and abilities. Ruthlessly rise above your rivals to be crowned the boss of bosses.

(website)

Players start with one boss card, but there is a public marketplace that allows players to fill out a tableau (their syndicate) by draft-purchasing up to 3 extra *historical* gangsters, 4 assets (usually venues associated with crime) and 4 upgrades (eg drug boats, evidence, guns, armor).

The tableau allows each gangster to be lined up with an Asset and an Upgrade which increase the gangster's abilities.
The players will take it in turn to activate each gangster, with various abilities including earning money, stealing money, attacking other gangsters, stealing other gangsters, destroying Assets/Upgrades and attempting a narcotics shipment. The success of these actions depends on a dice roll, but increasing the gangsters' abilities increases their chance of success. If they do not succeed, a gangster they have targeted will usually have an ability that allows retaliation.

Some of the Assets (locations) give income at the end of each round, if they still have a gangster assigned to them.
At the end of four rounds, the player with the most money is the winner.

(NB this is based on the 2018 version of the game)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Encantados is a filler where players assumes the role of a gardener in need to populate his garden with magical creatures. Fairies, leprechauns, gnomes, goblins and Kobolds! Every race has a special ability to help you (or disturb your friend/opposing team). Encantados knows how to balance simplicity with an awesome replay and a lot of fun. Wonderful in every way , whether in its simple mechanics, either in its neat art!

Encantados is played in a series of rounds. Every round, in alternate turns, players buy a new card and have the chance to play one Song and one Set of cards of the same Magical Creature. You can only play creatures if you have three of a kind in your hand. After you play them, they start giving you passive bonus. If one or more players empty their hand the round is over and points are counted. If, by the end of a round, a player score is 100 or higher he is the winner!
—description from the publisher

What changes:
> A 2ª edição está mais enxuta, com a caixinha no formato de blister, em vez da caixa com tampa, e apenas cartas como componentes.
> O jogo terá um deck para 2 a 4 jogadores, em vez dos dois decks para 2 a 6 jogadores (ainda será possível jogarem até 6 com duas cópias do jogo - as regras dessa variante estão no manual).
> Entra um personagem novo (o Troll) e sai um antigo (a Mandragora, que deixa saudades mas é lembrada carinhosamente em todas as cartas do jogo :'( ).
> Poderes das raças revisados com objetivo de tornar o jogo mais amigável para não gamers e pontuações das cartas reequilibradas.
> Novo projeto gráfico e manual revisado com pequenas alterações.
—user summary

Four Corner Kingdoms involves building a tableau of your kingdom using unique placement mechanisms to create combinations of icon types, suite types, etc. which score at the end of the game. Additional aspects of the cards can interfere with your opponents.

Players play two cards from their hands, one at a time. They place the cards in their playing area (tableau) which also represents a map of the topography of their land. There are rules about what terrain does when it is placed (e.g. draw an additional card, gain immunity to attack for the round, etc.). The rules of how the cards are placed also depends on the terrain type.

Your decision of how you make your kingdom depends on trying to score certain elements while also using less valuable (point-wise) utility cards (cards that give you more cards, etc.).

—description from the publisher

The game consists of a deck of 54 cards, each with a single letter and point value on it, as well as several 'Free' cards that can be used as any letter. The entire deck is dealt out to all players face down. Players may not look at their deck, but on their turn, flip over the top card and add it to the center of the table. If they can make a word from the cards in the middle, they take it and score the points on those letters. Play continues until all cards are used, and the player with the highest score wins.

—user summary

Inspired by the 1950's sci-fi movie genre, players take on the role of one of 4 alien races, to dish out vengeance on their captors, the humans. Be it through conquest, abduction, or plain 'ole vaporizing! All of these can garner you Points, but you'll have to move fast as the humans are developing The Doomsday Device, or might drop you the A-Bomb!

On your turn you'll use cards to move, mitigate action dice, and plan your action that round. Will you conquer a location to use its benefits? (Area Control), Abduct humans for the end game points(Set Collection), or plain ole' vaporize them for points? Don't forget your initial mission on Earth as these secret Objectives can put you over the edge and win! The game ends when either all players have orbited, or the humans devellop the Doomsday Device or dropped the A-Bomb! Do you want to risk getting extra points, or will this be the round the humans will capture you once again?(Press Your Luck).

—description from the designer

A co-op survival dice game where the players take on the role of Ancestor spirits, who are guiding their living Descendants to the summit of a mountain. The tribe is making this pilgrimage to remember the Ancestors - and if the Descendants fail in their journey, the Ancestors will be forgotten for all eternity! The Ancestors must work together to help the tribe survive. The players win the game together if they manage to bring at least two Descendants to the mountaintop alive. Any fewer than that, and the players all lose.

The game is played in rounds (5 to 20 max) which represent "days" of travel. (Increasing duration increases game difficulty.) Each morning, the Shaman of the tribe rolls dice to interpret an Omen: resources that day will be Safe (neutral), Blessed (collect +1), or Cursed. Taking cursed items will result in additional Danger for the Descendant who disobeyed the Omen!

Randomized terrain cards provide opportunities to forage for various resources - food, medicine, firewood, and crystals for banishing hostile evil spirits. The Ancestors decide how best to match Descendants' skills to the resources available in any given location. The more lucrative places also contain the greatest likelihood for danger! A player rolls once for each Descendant who forages during the day.

Each player's role gives them a special power to intervene on behalf of the Descendants. Some banish evil spirits, heal Descendants, ward off sickness, or other helpful skills.

—description from the designer

A co-op storytelling card game where the players work together to guide the main character of a fantasy story to a suitable ending before any player runs out of cards.

Cards come in three suits: Characters, Places and Things. One of each card type is used to create the main character, the hero/ine of the story. A main character will also have a Trait and a Theme that help direct the narrative.

The players take turns as the Author to add cards from their hand to the table. Everyone who is waiting for a turn is an Editor. Editors offer suggestions (in the form of cards from their own hands), and reward the Author for creative plays with "Awesome cards" - as in "That was awesome!" - which are bonus cards added to the Author's stock.

Any card may introduce the namesake element into the story (eg. a volcano, Zombie, or mask), OR be used as an action to describe another character doing something (eg. incinerating, chasing, or tricking). The cards provide a growing pool of words to be used, reused and reinterpreted as the story goes on. The rules of narration may be as strict or generous as the players wish. Spontaneous role-playing and voice-acting are often observed in casual play.

The game ends when the main character's conflict is resolved, or any player runs out of cards. Players can resolve "cliff-hanger" endings in a number of ways: they may reveal the remaining cards, ad-lib a fitting resolution, or by player elimination.

CoAUTHORation can also be used for brainstorming or as a tool to overcome writer's block.

—description from the designer

ONE PLAYER IS THE KILLER
THE REST ARE VICTIMS

DON’T GET STABBED! is a party card game where you get to kill your family and friends (for pretend).

The killer wins by killing all the victims. The victims win by escaping.

Everyone takes turns drawing cards. If a victim gets three STAB cards, they DIE! But they can use ACTION cards to avoid getting stabbed. And they can use COMBO cards for a chance at escaping.

But the killer has special powers. If the killer draws a STAB card, they can put it back in the deck wherever they want. And the killer can use ACTION and COMBO cards to thwart the victims’ attempts to stay alive.

—description from the publisher

This is a fan-version of Carcassonne based in space. It replaces cities with habitats, roads with wormholes, and monastries with planets. The River becomes a Nebula and defines two different types of habitats.
It uses double-sided tiles that have to be drawn from a bag. This makes possible the introduction of tiles that trigger special actions.

—description from the designer

name.value: Yahtzee: Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean

item.description:
This game combines Yahtzee and Battle Yahtzee under the movie theme of Disney's Pirate of the Caribbean. In Battle Yahtzee version, each player starts as one of the captain from the franchise. They receive a card that illustrates the captain and provides a special power (each captain has a different one) to be used during the game.

From the publisher's website: 
Play the classic shake, score & shout dice game or battle it out on the seven seas in this special edition of The Pirates of the Caribbean Yahtzee. Custom playing pieces including dice, game board and ship tokens add a unique twist full of pirate adventure as you roll high scoring dice combinations on the high seas!

Welcome to the Lightspeed Space Station! As a skilled builder, help the station mark rockets capable of reaching the speed of light. Compete with others, earn the respect of Master Builders and become the best builder in the galaxy!

Robots & Rockets: Lightspeed is a competitive rocket-building card game for 2 to 4 players. The goal is to build and launch rockets to collect the greatest number of rocket parts by the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

The rumor that the Yeti comes around at the Alaska is spreading out. A lot of Hunters hear it and gather for hunting the Yeti at the INN in front of the Snow Mountain.

Right here is the Alaska INN! Players become the hunter and hunt the Yeti for honor. Of course, some of them have no interest in hunting the Yeti and others seek to make benefit through the other ways! Sell the items to hunters, or research about the trace of the Yeti. 
Anyway, this is most interesting case of various cases in West Land recently.

Players stay the Alaska INN during the winter season and expect to see the Yeti. Players place their hunters every rounds for performing the action they want. The capable Actions of players are following: Paying the cost to employ a hunter, Manufacturing the items using their own materials, Selling the own items, Scoring the points by providing the trace and by funding to INN, Going out for hunting (to catch the Yeti or material or the trace and others).

At every round, Environment Card must be open. The Environment Card gives issue to players regarding the trace, change of weather and etc. This game will end when the winter season is over or the Yeti is caught. At this time, a player scoring the highest point will be a winner.

—description from the publisher

Alliance: The Card Game is a fantasy, dueling card game with warring factions, fighting to become the new and true Alliance. Players can enjoy this simple-to-learn, two-player, battle game between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle. The game of chance, simplified strategy, and fantasy warfare!

Zaldar's return from the dead, with a dragon army behind him, has shaken the world and now armies and factions of all kinds rally for war! The world needs a new Alliance, but who will form this new Alliance? Will Zaldar reign supreme? Or will it be...you?

Objective of Game: Battle between armies to defeat your opponent's Leader and win the battle.

Components of Game: 35 Cards per deck, 6 sided die, Health Point Tokens, Game Board, Scroll of Rules, & stickers

How To Play: 
Leader Appears - place your Leader closest to you. The Leader will not be able to battle until the army in front of the Leader is defeated. 
Shuffle - shuffle your deck and place your deck face down to your right.
Army Line Up - draw the top 5 cards from your deck and place them face up in front of your Leader. This is your army, ready for battle.
Roll Order - both players roll the die. Whoever rolls the highest number goes first. Each turn consists of a Placement Phase and a Battle Phase. 
Placement Phase - if you have an army space open place the next top card from your deck in its place.
Battle Phase - you may attack twice per turn, but not with the same character. First declare who you're attacking by whom you're attacking with. Roll the die. If the number matches your character's Roll Number, you deal the character's corresponding Attack Number to your opponent's character's Health Points. If not, the attack misses and no damage is dealt. If damage is dealt more than your opponent's character's Health Points, then the character is slain and placed in the Slain Pile. If damage is dealt less than your opponent's character's Health Points, then Health Points are replaced with the correctly numbered Health Point Token. 
Leader's Entrance - Your Leader comes into play when your army is depleted and no Units or Generals stand in front of him. The Leader can now attack, dealing the most damage on the battlefield, but can also be attacked by your opponent. 
Victory - Once your Leader's Health Points reach 0 you lose the battle. If your opponent's Leader's Health Points reach 0 you win the battle

Classes: 
Unit - bulk of army, 30 per deck, average attack and health points, & adorned with copper frame and tablet
General - more powerful characters on the battlefield, 4 per deck, stronger attack and health points, & adorned with silver frame and tablet
Leader - Leader of your army/Alliance, 1 per deck, strongest attack and health points & adorned with golden frame and tablet

Battling: Roll Numbers & Attack Numbers
When battling roll the die. If your roll matches your character's Roll Number then you deal the corresponding Attack Number (below the Roll Number). If the Attack Number is higher than your opponent's character's Health Points, then it's Slain and sent to the Slain Pile. If the Attack Number is lower than your opponent's character's Health Points, than replace their Health Points with the correctly numbered Health Point Token.

Character Types: 
Warrior
Beast 
Mage 
Beast Warrior
Beast Mage

Health Point Tokens:
The numbered, circle tokens replace a character's Health Points after they take damage. If you character takes 3 damage, from your opponent, and your character's Health Points are 5 then you replace your character's Health Points with the Health Point Token numbered 2.

—description from the designer

Set in New York in the mid 1970's, Borgata challenges players to outwit their opponents, in order to become the most respected member of their family.

A deck building game where players are able to recruit Mobsters, purchase Weapons, earn income, and bribe public officials in order to control a handful of Businesses and Boroughs. Players interact by attacking one another with the cards they have acquired. The goal is to gain Respect cards, which are used to move up through the ranks. The game ends when one player does this and successfully becomes a Mafia Boss.
 Borgata is designed to encourage interaction and strategy. Players are often forced to work together in order to prevent a rival player from winning.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Limite limite limite is a stand alone game or can be an expansion for the game Limite Limite with new cards.

Limite limite is a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny, with the proposed cards having a big chance of being offensive.

A strong knowledge of French language and culture (it that exists) is recommended to understand everything.

When it comes to food, lots of people are willing to do anything. And with that bustling market in that food business, you wouldn't miss a chance to pick up the opportunity for your food joint rise up into fame and fortune. That's not all, popularity race is on the take and you need to snatch one of them to boost its fame.

Assign your workers to fetch ingredients to different place in the neighborhood and take orders from your customers. Serve Indonesian authentic food dishes and get various kind of rewards. With calculated planning and right opportunities, your joint might be the next big thing!

Nusa Rasa is a simple worker placement game with resource management, area majority and set collection, that pits players in a competitive business of restaurants serving local authentic dishes from across Indonesia provinces. The game offers 2 distinct modes (family and advance), in which have similar game play but different feel and approach.

Family Mode
Simple worker placement game where players assign workers to get resources they need to serve order cards and get rewards. Players can serve orders any time during their turn without limitation.

Advance Mode
Unlike Family mode, now in Advance more, there are Serving Phase occurs after each three rounds of the game. Players may only serve orders in this phase and there is penalty if they cannot serve the orders that they had. They also need to pay their workers and resources are discarded after they serve orders. This mode provides experienced players more challenge and planning to consider. The game is designed to be harder than the normal Family mode.

—description from the designer

Calavera is a Roll & Write game where each player wants to make as many crosses on his block as possible because many crosses bring many points. But beware! If the players are too greedy, their valuable points melt away again. Whoever chooses the best die result and makes the crosses in the right place wins. This is how it is played: 

 Everybody collects as many crosses in each colour as possible on his block page. 
 But be careful, if players come in the so-called death zone, their points are less. 
 Or they even get minus points. 
 Who quickly secures his valuable points and wins the game?




—description provided by publisher

item.description:
Silent Crash is a social deduction bidding game of cornering the market on shifting resources.

â€‹It is a 3-11 player game running to roughly 30 minutes play time per round. It requires nothing apart from the 2 page low ink PDF file available for download and printing at the bottom of the page. 

It is a simple bidding, bluffing and social deduction game designed to represent competing to corner the market on various stock market shares. Knowing if you've successfully controlled the market and betting accordingly is the root to financial success and crushing your competition. 

Originally designed based on a hidden loyalty bidding mechanic for a multi-player wargame, Silent Crash became too complicated to be part of another game, but not fully developed enough for a full release. As such we have made it available as a free Print and Play.

Players bid on whether they have the resource which occurs the lowest unique number of times. They gain points by successfully doing so and can swap resources based on other player's bids.  

—description from the publisher

Moonflight is a deck builder with an unusual, deck un-building twist. Players must build a deck in order to have the resources to buy scoring cards but when the game ends only cards in hand will score, so any resource generating but non-scoring cards become garbage in the later half of the game. The winner will be the player who un-builds as well as they build.

The game is set in a mythic fay town, Moonflight, which comes about with the waxing of the hunter's moon and fades with its setting. Players take the part of one of the mysterious Jacks, the rulers of Moonflight, and must be the most powerful of their kind when they walk away at night's end.

Game play is based around the "turn". When the market place is exhausted all cards spin to a second version, activating card trashing rather than resource gaining abilities. The game ends when one player attempts to draw a card and cannot, at which point players score exactly which cards are in their hands.

—description from the publisher

A simple, competitive dice party game best for larger groups.

Each turn you roll your dice and depending on the results choose to either add to the lobster which helps you achieve the winning goal of getting rid of all your dice or create a claw to cut the lobster which lets you hand out the severed dice to your opponents pushing them further away from winning.

—description from the designer

Tricky Billy is a trick-taking game with 5 suits. Each suit has a card which represents a special rule change (e.g. if the Billy suit rule is in effect, the lowest ranked card will win the trick).

The start player may lead any suit, at which point the card for that suit is marked to indicate it was the lead suit. Subsequent players must play either the lead suit or the suit marked with the special rule card.

For each trick, the first player who cannot follow either of the marked suits may play any suit, and the special rule card marker moves to this suit.

At the end of the game, the player with the second most points wins.

In Pearls, players dive for valuable pearls, then try to sell them at local markets. You either collect or score pearl cards of the same color (and value) on your turn. Cards with higher value score more points, but are less common. Pearls with lower value may seem weaker at first, but if you score a larger quantity of cards at once, you receive a necklace card with bonus points, if available. With a hand limit of ten cards, however, this requires clever hand management and timing.

At the end of the game, all pearl and necklace cards in your scoring piles score positive points and any cards left in your hand score minus points. The player with the highest total score wins.

item.description:
Feelinks Revelations is the adult stand-alone sequel to Feelinks. After the success of the first, children-oriented, version, Act In Games has decided to expand the Feelinks experience to adults.

The game is now fully cooperative and plays in about 30 minutes for 2 to 8 players.

While never being rude or inappropriate, this version of the game presents over 300 new situations intended for adults and teenagers over 16.

During a game, you :

 Pick a card and chose a situation to read.
 Choose the emotion that matches how you feel and correctly estimate your fellow players' feelings.
 Show your mutual choices, reveal the correct estimation, then take a step, if needed, on the empathy track, then go again.




As the main course of a romantic evening or as the dessert of good game night with friends, Feelinks Revelations will test how well players know each other...

Will you reach the top of the empathy track ?

—description from the publisher

Limite limite Gold is a new expansion for the game Limite Limite, a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny, with the proposed cards having a big chance of being offensive. A strong knowledge of French language and culture is recommended to understand everything.

The Game of Wolf is a trivia game in which players play wolves, ravenous for trivia. On your turn, you may pick pack members based on their knowledge of the subject or go Lone Wolf for a chance to double the points! The Pack or Lone Wolf that answers the most correct of the five questions wins the points for that round!

Will you go it alone, Wolf? Or will you choose strength in numbers?

—description from the publisher
Compete against your fellow filthy minded friends in a race to guess the lewd phrase using the iconic language of Badmoji. The player with the most points at the end of two full rounds is the winner.

Sagrada is a city where people of extraordinary powers live. You seek an item that can control all the powers - The MacGuffin.
Get the item by using the powers of characters.

Every turn, you start with a card, then you draw a card, and then play a card- following the text on the card. If you manage to play 9 cards, or you have the MacGuffin out at the beginning of your turn, you win.

You secretly pick a running play. Your opponent sets a pass defense. Now go to the special Snap-Action dice for the outcome. Runs, passes, punts, field goals...this pocket-sized game has all the elements of real football...except the crunch of the pads.

—description from the back of the box

A Cooperative Game of Survival, Exploration, and Escape

Loosely based on Jules Verne's novel "The Mysterious Island"

In the early 1860s, a hot-air balloon carrying six friends, crash landed on an uncharted island in the South Pacific Ocean. Together, they must craft, explore, and move during the day and fight off threats at night. Survivors will move across the island finding clues that will reveal story moments and help them how to escape the island. However, as they move toward their ultimate goal, time is running out, as a catastrophic event will unfold at the end of 30 days!

Mysterious Island is a cooperative survival game that uses an action point system for players to make strategic choices. In conjunction with those choices is the variability of cards drawn during the Day and Night Phases. These cards often will determine how players make their choices.

The Day and Night decks double as a "timer" for the end of game. Once they run out, the game is over and the survivors lose in catastrophic fashion. Of course, staying alive while searching for a way off the island is another adventure of its own.

The Craft and Explore decks offer the player ways to improve their skills and chance of survival. The 35 Craft cards will ALWAYS provide items to help survivors along their way. The 35 Explore cards have both positive and negative effects on the players depending what is drawn.

Out of the 130 cards used in a game, only 6 are doubles, which makes each game session very unique. These variables offer high re-playability and make the gaming experience different each time.

If you or someone you know love adventure games with elements of survival and exploration, give Mysterious Island a try!

—description from the designer

link.value: Paths of Peril: A Mysterious Island Card Game

item.description:
Story

Lancelot, the greatest of all of King Arthur’s knights, was accused of having romantic trysts with Queen Guinevere. First to accuse him was Meliagaunt, whom Lancelot challenged in combat to prove the Queen’s innocence. During the contest, Lancelot cleaved his opponent’s head in half and cleared the Queen of those charges. However, rumors continued to abound and soon other knights became suspicious. Sir Agravain and Sir Mordred gathered twelve knights and stormed Guinevere’s chamber, finding Lancelot there with the Queen. Now you, as Sir Lancelot, must try to escape and fight your way out of the castle and prove the innocence of Queen Guinevere before King Arthur has her burned to death for infidelity.

Object of the Game

You are fighting to escape the perils of the castle and, at the same time, trying to defend the Honor of the Queen you love. You will test your Knightly Virtues against those of the 14 knights standing in your way and fight to emerge victorious. If you can defeat 8 of the 14 knights along your path you will clear the name of your Queen and escape into the night. However, all is not as easy as it may seem. With every failure to defeat a knight, your Knightly Virtues will decrease and the Honor of your Queen will move one step closer to peril. Should you lose to 7 knights, or have two of your Virtues reach a value of 0, Lancelot will be banished from the lands and the Queen will burn for her sins.

—description from the publisher

name.value: What's the Word?: The Card Game

item.description:
Put those little grey cells to the test with What's the Word – a fun connecting game where players have to figure out the word that links four seemingly random pictures! Compete with friends and family to see who can make the connection quickest.

Players are confronted with picture cards featuring 4 linked images and are then required to come up with the single word that links all four! With 50 different picture cards included, What's the Word is great fun for parties and family occasions, and is sure to get everyone playing and having fun.

Easy to pick up and play, the game comes with full game play instructions, and is suitable for all the family. What's the Word is fun, yet challenging

—description from the publisher

Read all about it! In this era of fake news, can you tell the truth from the lie? Play The News Game and test your powers of deduction, along with your friends, and play this super-fun, laugh-out-loud game.

One person reads out the headline followed by the story and you have to guess whether its real or fake news!

This game contains 100 'true or false' question cards and also comes with full gameplay instructions. A great game for your next dinner party, The News Game is a fabulous gift for lovers of quizzes and current affairs.

—description from the publisher

name.value: The Name of the Wind: Sympathy Dueling

item.description:
"Sympathy is not for the weak of mind.” 
â€• Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

Based on the bestselling book from author Patrick Rothfuss: "The Name of the Wind - Sympathy Dueling" is a 2-player head-to-head battle using the book's unique magic system.

Players divide a standard 52â€card deck into a Red deck and Black deck. Each player takes a color deck and shuffles, and then deals 4 cards face up in a vertical line. These 4 cards represent the player’s “candle”.

The table area in front of the player is the player’s “mind”. Here they will be able to draw and play cards from their source deck.

To win, player's use their cards to "light" the opponent's candle by converting all 4 cards to their color.

—description from the designer

Somewhere in a dark but distant future, humankind is fighting a war for survival against its greatest threat - a changing climate. The polar ice caps have melted, entire civilizations, swept away almost overnight. A distant rust-covered memory, the world we knew has been swallowed whole, lost in the murky depths of an unforgiving ocean.

Desperate, starving, and lacking the technical achievements of a forgotten era, the surviving population propels steam-powered engines towards the farthest corners of earth in search of the faintest glimmer of hope. Some found this hope on a plot of ocean simply known as the Arena. Through uncharted waters, there lies a thousand islands eroded by time, where untold riches await to be discovered by the remnants of past civilizations. You are among the desperate few in search of those lost treasures.

SteamPunk Arena is a turn-based strategy game with an objective to explore the islands looking for salvage, exploit the resources you find there, expand your domain using bridge networks, and exterminate your opponent. In SteamPunk Arena, each combatant chooses a faction, and then chooses the hero who will lead that faction into battle. These heroes will help spur theatre-specific units on by providing an action modifying bonus.

The combatants begin the conflict with the same garrisoned unit strength and an equal amount of land; however, this is where your similarities will end. Where you place your Base Tile or Land Tiles is entirely up to you. What lies hidden and waiting to be discovered could also provide a unique advantage or disadvantage. But keep in mind no matter what your path looks like, the dice-roll will often decide the outcome of events that transpire throughout the playthrough.

Using a turn-based unit action system. The combatant controls the action of active units throughout the duration of the turn until all action points are spent. The health of the unit is determined by a population or hit-point, found in the center of the piece. Units can only be deployed one per turn. There are only so many population points you can have active on the arena game boards at any given time, unless modified by a certain Resource or Unit Bonus. So choose your army wisely and enjoy the fight. We will see you out in the Arena!

name.value: Toys R Us: The Board Game

item.description: Toys R Us themed game with the basic mechanics of Monopoly.

Tike’s Dungeon can be played as a solo adventure or as a 2-4 player co-op. Above that, it can be played in two different styles: Turn-based board game where players take turns to explore the crypt and battling creatures and the narrative-driven role-playing game (RPG). In both styles of play, the players will take on the role of a Tike and are highly encouraged to interact with and help each other.

"Raivynwood is a small but prosperous village nestled neatly in the, get this, Raivynwood forest. It is most well known for its local militia which is comprised of some of the most well-trained soldiers in the land. But it has another, rather unfortunate, claim to fame which is a little less known, and that is that Raivynwood is a hub of catastrophe. If anything can go wrong, anything in the world, it will go wrong in Raivynwood. That may be the reason for needing such well-trained men and women, or that could just be a coincidence.
The training in Raivynwood starts at the ripe age of 5, these boys and girls are called the CIC (Combat Initiative Cubs). They mostly play with sticks and wooden shields in childish games that have a fortunate side-effect of teaching them how to kick butt. The Cubs graduate at the age of 7 when they become CIBs (Combat Initiative Bloomer). CIBs practice with dull metal weapons, begin to learn the bow and learn the value of respecting and helping their parents. It’s an important lesson, you know? Finally, at the harsh age of 11, Bloomers get promoted to the Raivynwood CIA (Combat Initiative Adepts). As a junior member of the Raivynwood CIA it is your duty to train hard and watch over your small piece of paradise when the grownups aren’t around.
On this day, of all days… the day on which the grownups have all gone to the eastern forest edge to confront a new lizardfolk threat… misfortune has stricken. As you and your fellow CIA members train in the city square, showing off your moves and flirting with your crush, you are disrupted…"

—description from the designer

Hadara dives you into the world of cultures and countries of this earth. Over three epochs, you will experience the transformation of your new world from a small settlement to a high culture. You want to populate this world with people who come from different cultures and continents as well as different ages. To bring glory and honor to your world, you should choose the persons and accomplishments skillfully. But you should not ignore agriculture, culture, and military power, for otherwise one of your competitors might get bigger and more successful than you. Who first succeeds in creating a new flourishing high culture?

—description from the publisher

•••

Hadara entführt dich in die Welt der Kulturen und Länder dieser Erde.

Über 3 Epochen hinweg erlebst du die Verwandlung deiner neuen Welt von einer kleinen Siedlung zu einer Hochkultur.
Du willst diese Welt mit Personen besiedeln, die dabei aus verschiedenen Kulturkreisen, Kontinenten aber auch Zeitaltern stammen. 
Um deiner Welt zu viel Ruhm und Ehre zu verhelfen, solltest du die Personen und Errungenschaften geschickt aussuchen. Dabei solltest du aber die Landwirtschaft, die Kultur und die militärische Macht nicht außer Acht lassen, sonst kann es passieren, dass einer deiner Mitkonkurrenten größer und erfolgreicher wird. Wem gelingt es zuerst, eine neue blühende Hochkultur zu erschaffen?
—description from the publisher (German)

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
In MÅ«, you build a city composed of nine building cards, with these cards coming in five types adorned with "source symbols" for strength, faith, and food. Each edge of a building card has a semi-circle on it showing half of a source symbol. Cards also have complete symbols for strength, faith, and food on them.

Each player starts the game with two project cards — cards fueled by source tokens — and an empty 3x3 grid that shows semi-circular source symbols around the edges. The game lasts four rounds, and in each round you draft three cards. At the end of the second, third, and fourth rounds, all players compare their strengths in various horizontal or vertical rows on their grid.

In the first round, you draft three project cards, each with special effects that can be used if you fill all the source symbols on it. In each of the next three rounds, you draft and play three building cards. When you play a building card and complete one or more source symbols (by matching the colors on each half symbol), you receive a source token of that color for each completed symbol, which you must immediately place on a project.

After the third, sixth, and ninth building cards have been placed, you compare your strength in the row or column indicated on battle cards. (You have two such challenges after rounds six and nine.) The player with the most strength in the appropriate row or column receives 3 achievement points (AP), while the loser marks that row or column with a damage token. If a building card has damage in both its row and column, it's destroyed and removed from the game.

At the end of the game, players feed their city, scoring based on the number of food symbols they have and the number of non-destroyed buildings. Players also score AP for faith symbols in their city.

MÅ« also contains rules for a solitaire game.

item.description:
There's confusion among the YÅkai!

These Japanese spirits have become intermingled in YÅkai, and to calm them, you have to group together members of the same family. They're hiding, however, so to carry out your task successfully, you have to be clever and not make any noise to avoid frightening them...

Wooden Boardgame for 2-6 players with pigs. 
18x18x4cm

Your Goal is to distribute all pigs among other players.

Each player gets same amount of those cute little pigs. 
Once it is your turn, you roll the die (D6) and place one of your pigs into the specific are of the boardgame.

Once the specific area is already full, you need to take all pigs from the playarea/boardgame.

First round you have to throw the die once. 
2nd round you have to throw the die twice. 
Last round you have to throw the die minimum once put it is up to you to throw more often.

—user summary

You are a painter in Couleurs de Paris, and you've decided to participate in "Bateau Lavoir", a friendly competition between several painters in a workshop in Montmartre, Paris. The newspapers know about this challenge, so perhaps this is a good opportunity to become famous, following the path of Cézanne, Toulouse-Lautrec, Monet, or Renoir...

Couleurs de Paris is a management game in which you must take care of your paint tubes, mixtures, and time to create works, all the while anticipating others to perform as needed within a rotating set of actions.

item.description:
In the summer of 1941, German panzer spearheads pushed towards Leningrad, Cradle of the Revolution. Adolf Hitler declared the city's capture to be the leading objective of Operation Barbarossa, the June 1941 sneak attack on the Soviet Union. Desperate to stop them and preserve the city of Peter the Great, the Red Army repeatedly made valiant efforts to stop them, and just as often, the Germans rolled over and around them. By August the city had been isolated from the rest of the Soviet Union, but its defenders refused to yield. For 900 days they held against savage Nazi bombardments, writing an epic chapter in the story of the Great Patriotic War.

Gates of Leningrad is a complete Panzer Grenadier game based on based on the German drive to capture Leningrad, and the Soviet defense of the approaches. There are 30 scenarios based on these battles, organized into ten “battle games” that allow you to play the scenarios in sequence toward your army’s operational goals.

—description from the publisher

In late May 1940, the German Air Force launched history’s first large-scale airborne invasion, dropping a division of paratroopers onto the island of Crete, followed by a mountain division landed from transport planes. For thirteen days the motley Allied garrison of Australian, New Zealand and Greek troops put up fierce resistance before the Germans finally secured the island at a cost of one-fifth of their force killed, wounded or missing.

Parachutes over Crete is a complete Panzer Grenadier game based on the Battle for Crete. There are 40 scenarios based on these battles, organized into six “battle games” that allow you to play the scenarios in sequence toward your army’s operational goals.

—description from the publisher

You are an investigation team sent to a tragic event. A passenger car has crashed after a short car chase. The driver has fled, while the officer who participated in the hunt lies on the asphalt dead of gun shot wounds. From the trunk of the passenger car, a desperate rattle is heard from a dying woman. Nude, shot and with a strange sign cut into her upper body. Two fingers amputated. You soon find out that she is one of the five women who have disappeared in recent months.

Nominated for Best Board Game at Fastaval 2018.

The "ritual" is a macabre crime quest that you must solve. By calculating codes and combinations of tracks on different cards, you dig your way through the investigation.

You start the game via a smartphone at 50clues.com, which keeps track of time and helps you along the way. This is where you enter codes and combine clues from the cards. Making errors or using the help function costs extra time that is added to the total time spent. It's life or death to solve the puzzle quickly.

If you love crime stories and cryptic puzzles, then the "ritual" is for you.

It only takes three minutes to get started with the game.

In your society, tirelessly dictators succeed one another in power. The people decided to organize to overthrow once and for all this bloody dictatorship that no longer hides. Only listening to your courage, you decide to join a revolutionary group at the risk of your life. Unfortunately, reactionary traitors are hiding among you...

Each player draws a comrade card, take 4 to 6 life tokens, 4 actions cards and a secret camp. The first dictator is revealed in the center of the table. When it's your turn attack the dictator, heal your comrade or win some time. According to your action, launch the dice and know what fate awaits you: jail, injury or worst?

The revolutionary camp must overthrow all the dictators while the reactionary camp must kill everybody before the dictatorship falls.

Beware of what you say and what you play, because if someone reveals the guillotine card, you must vote together to kill a player immediately!

—description from the designer

item.description:
Marine microbes form the basis of life in the ocean and perform 50% of earth’s photosynthesis. But they live extraordinary lives of their own; fraught with danger and opportunity.

Oligotrophic is a fast-to-learn, strategic tile placement game where players compete to place biomass the fastest. In the game players will select and play hexagonal cards based on actual microorganisms to accumulate biomass, often getting bonuses, hurting, or taking biomass from the other organisms they encounter.

Oligotrophic is fully available online in both full color and print friendly versions in the files section. All that is needed is 20 cubes of a color for each player.

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Crazier Eights: Shahrzad is an expandalone — it can be played as a stand alone game or as an expansion for Crazier Eights: One Thousand & One Nights. You get enough cards for a three player game. It has thirty three new unique cards inspired by Shahrzad’s stories.

Rather than eights, Shahrzad has multicolored cards and split cards. Split cards, such as Might & Magic, shown above, are treated like multicolored cards when they are discarded, but you have to choose one side when you play it for the ability.

Shahrzad was a stretch goal for the Kickstarter campaign for Crazier Eights: 1001 Nights.

link.value: Crazier Eights: One Thousand & One Nights

item.description:
To feed your prehistoric clan, your tribespeople must force Mammoths over the side of a cliff. Just be careful that you don't sink into a tarpit, get stomped by a Mammoth — or run right off the cliff yourself in the process. This "Guts-style" game has you trying to outthink your opponents and maneuver them into harm's way...until "WHAMM!", one tribe emerges victorious.

Wooly Whammoth features identical eight-card hands, each card showing a number of spaces that must be moved — but it is the total number, adding all the cards played that hand, which determines just how far ALL the cave people will run. Some have modifiers to slow down or speed up your cave person alone - and quickly getting out of sync with the others is how you will survive and send them over the edge. Getting two spaces from the edge is how you will earn Mammoth Meat as the wooly beasts plunge to the valley below — and it take six Meat tokens to win. BUT to refill your hand, you must eat a Meat, in a lovely balancing act.

Your two-piece modular board becomes elongated after every successful hunt, changing the conditions and lengths individual players have to go to score a Mammoth.

Of course, the other way to win is to eliminate all four of your opponents' tribespeople by forcing them into tar pits, crushing them under CHARGING mammoths, or sending them flying over the cliff. It's a think, double-think, guts game of prehistoric survival!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Based on the hit mobile game AdVenture Capitalist!
Have you always dreamed of owning your own business? Being the master of your own destiny? Forming your own multi-national conglomerate to create a world-wide, monopolistic economy? Then AdVenture Capitalist is the game for YOU!

AdVenture Capitalist is played in 4 simple steps:
1) Over 3 rounds, Be the player who has gained the most income from your businesses!
2) At the start of each round you are dealt a Manager which you keep hidden until the end of the round. Managers provide secret boosts to your drafted businesses at the end of the round. 
3) Draft businesses to get the best card combo's. 
4) Profit.

Choose the right cards and you can dominate the market! The only way to go is UP UP UP!

—description from the publisher

Galactic Bounty Hunt (GBH) is a gateway board game where each player controls one of six different Bounty Hunters that are taking part in the Great Hunt – the ultimate bounty hunting competition, which will determine who’ll earn the position of Leader of the Galactic Bounty Hunter’s Guild. Competitors will have to travel across the Galaxy, capturing dangerous creatures (and earning credits in the process) in different systems before being able to return to the Guild’s HQ and claiming the title of Leader. Equip your character with the best gear available and be on the lookout, for monsters might not be your deadliest foes – other Bounty Hunters might not want to let you earn the so-coveted prize of the Great Hunt! Good hunting!

Features:


 GBH introduces players to many different gameplay mechanics and systems, in an easy to learn way – the perfect introduction to the world of modern board games. Mechanics include dice rolls, card drawing, luck mitigation systems (ammo, equipments,etc), PvP (player-vs-player) combat and more.
 No player elimination and no Kingmaker effect: even when the game seems lost, players can still turn the tide in their favor.
 Beautiful cel-shaded, comic-style art.
 Six different Bounty Hunters to play as, each from a different species and System.
 Twelve different kinds of monsters to capture, two of each element.
 Dozens of different pieces of equipment, from weapon mods to consumable items, will give you an edge, as long as you choose carefully – and can afford them.
 Warp through the Galaxy at light speed using the portals on each System – but take heed, for you can’t be sure where each portal might take you.
 Fortune cards will keep the game unpredictable: they can help or hinder any of the players, independently of who triggered the event. Mix things up a little to turn the tide – for or against you.
 Keep the best monsters you capture as pets to engage in fights with other players.
 Falling behind on your trophy collecting? Not to worry! Board another Hunter’s ship, engage in combat and try to steal one of their trophies.


—description from the publisher

name.value: ジュエリー アントワープ (Jewelry Antwerp)

link.value: siroup games (シロップゲームズ)
